titlestmt.titleproper: Helen Godey Wilson catalog, in Wilson's hand, of books by William McFee 1923-1959
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

publicationstmt.publisher: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: Helen Godey Wilson catalog, in Wilson's hand, of books by William McFee
did.repository: University of Pennsylvania, Rare Book and Manuscript Library

bioghist.p: Helen Godey Wilson was the granddaughter of Lewis A. Godey, publisher of Godey's Lady's Book. Her library was given to Robert Dechert, who later presented it to the University of Pennsylvania Library. William McFee (1881-1966) was a writer of sea stories.

scopecontent.p: This is an alphabetical catalog of William McFee books owned by Helen Godey Wilson, listing particulars of publication, a physical description, with some provenance information. The collection also includes a 1930 letter from McFee to Wilson regarding her acquisition of several of his books and a biographical sketch of McFee by Harry E. Maule.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
